item.title: St George's flag graffitied on mini roundabout at junction between Leckhampton Road and Church Road, also at Leckhampton road and Charlton Lane, 28th August
item.description:
First noticed on Tuesday 26th, the two miniroundabloiuts are in close proximity to each other and both have been graffitied with a St Georges cross, implying racism in a predominantly white area and currently being used as anti- immigration graffiti.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 164, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags fixed to street lighting on Tewkesbury Road, 28th August
item.description:
There are multiple union flags on Tewkesbury Road A4019 attached to street lighting with cable ties. They are between Kingsditch Trading Park and Gallagher Retail Park (and possibly elsewhere - this is where I observed them). Objects placed without permission on highway land is an offence under the Highways Act 1980. Furthermore, the display of union flags and St George flags has been used as a far right symbol, and must be removed to avoid fear among residents, and to discourage displays of racism such as the riots around the UK last year. Please remove the flags as soon as possible. Many thanks for your help with this request.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe uneven road surface, 27th August
item.description:
There is a severe uneven bump on the road. Not sure if this is subsidence or from road works, but it feels like your vehicle will have all 4 wheels leave the road if driving at full speed. It at the very least needs a warning sign.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury

item.title: Litter all along the A38 through Norton, 27th August
